functions.name: Database
functions.text: This module contains methods to list and open databases, explicitly apply available index structures, or get information on the database structure. All functions are introduced with the db: prefix.

function.name: system
function.summary: Lists information on the database system.
function.rule: This function returns general information on the database system, such as the database path and current database settings.

function.name: list
function.rule: This function returns a xs:string sequence with the names of all databases.

function.name: open
function.rule: This function opens the documents of the database specified by $name. The name of the database may be extended by a collection path.
function.example: The expression db:open("docs") returns all documents from the database named docs.
The expression db:open("docs/one") returns all documents from the database named docs in the subpath one.
function.error: is raised if the database is not found.

function.name: open-pre
function.rule: This function opens the database specified by $name and returns the node with the pre value specified by $pre.
function.example: The expression db:open-pre("docs", 0) returns the first database node from the database named docs.
function.error: is raised if the specified $pre value does not exist in the database.

function.name: open-id
function.rule: This function opens the database specified by $name and returns the node with the id value specified by $id.
In contrast to the pre value, the id will remain valid after update operations.
function.error: is raised if the specified $id does not exist in the database.

function.name: text-index
function.summary: Returns results from a text index request.
function.rule: This function accesses the text index and returns all text nodes that have $string as string value.
function.error: is raised if the index is not available.
is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.

function.name: attribute-index
function.summary: Returns results from a attribute index request.
function.rule: This function accesses the attribute index and returns all attribute nodes that have $string as string value.
If $name is specified, the resulting attribute nodes are filtered by their attribute name.
function.error: is raised if the index is not available.
is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.

function.name: fulltext-index
function.summary: Returns results from a full-text index request.
function.rule: This function accesses the full-text index and returns all text nodes that contain $text.
function.error: is raised if the index is not available.
is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.

function.name: info
function.rule: This function returns information on the database that is referenced by the current context item.
function.error: is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.

function.name: index-info
function.rule: This function returns information on an index of the database that is referenced by the current context item.
$type must be one of the values TEXT, ATTRIBUTE, FULLTEXT, PATH, TAG, or ATTNAME.
function.error: is raised if the specified index is not available.
is raised if the context item does not represent a database node.
